dc_title_s: HAZUS Flood Analysis for Sullivan County, Pennsylvania
dc_description_s: A HAZUS flood analysis is an estimation of economic and social losses associated with a specific return period of flooding. Results are provided as direct and indirect losses, and direct and induced damages.  Components which are modeled in the flood analysis include direct damage to buildings, essential facilities, transportation facilities and lifelines.  Other components include direct losses associated with the cost of repair or replacement of buildings, essential facilities, transportation facilities, and income loss, shelter and recovery needs. \r\nNOTE: you need to download an extension to use this .hpr file in ArcGIS
